newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-St George has OK for no meeting.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-St George has OK for no meeting.

text.p: St George Bank Ltd said on Thursday it has received approval from the Australian Stock Exchange to proceed with its A$2.65 billion takeover of Advance Bank Australia Ltd without first calling a meeting of St George shareholders.
St George sought a ruling from the ASX that a shareholder meeting to approve the takeover of the fellow regional bank would not be required under listing rules.
"As a result of this ruling, St George has confirmed a meeting will not be held," Sydney-based St George said.

Recent media reports said St George had discussed the issue of a shareholders meeting with some institutional investors who wanted to publicly debate the merits of the bid, which some analysts have said favoured Advance shareholders.
National Australia Bank Ltd, the largest shareholder in St George with a 6.8 percent stake, may have attempted to scuttle the takeover if a meeting was held, one newspaper report said.
St George said the ASX waiver followed the takeover's approval from the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission and a rating upgrade from Standard and Poor's Corp.
